body:
This PR introduce a new option for `vim.fs.dir` and `vim.fs.find` to follow symbolic links.
The default behaviour now turns on the `follow` feature, users can opt out of it with `follow=false`

comment_regular_data.body: LGTM but there are ci failures

nitpick: I think there's a risk of infinite recursion if the symbolic link is circular. Vimscript's `resolve()` handles this with the following behavior:

> To cope with link cycles, resolving of symbolic links is stopped after 100 iterations.

I think it should also be possible to detect if it's a circular loop and throw an error in that case (I have vague memories of some path libraries going this route, but not swearing on it).

For what it's worth I think the PR is fine as is currently, mentioning it mostly for awareness or if it's an edge case we want to handle in the future.

> nitpick: I think there's a risk of infinite recursion if the symbolic link is circular. Vimscript's `resolve()` handles this with the following behavior:
> 
> > To cope with link cycles, resolving of symbolic links is stopped after 100 iterations.
> 
> I think it should also be possible to detect if it's a circular loop and abort in that case (I have vague memories of some path libraries going this route, but not swearing on it).
> 
> For what it's worth I think the PR is fine as is currently, mentioning it mostly for awareness or if it's an edge case we want to handle in the future.

I also thought about the infinite recursion problem since I myself encountered this issue in a repo I was working on, although I found it using `fd|rg`,  the 100 limit in `resolve()` is quite sensible solution but I think that for `vim.fs.find()|vim.fs.dir()` it may be too limiting.
